alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 10:40AM CST until January 30 at 12:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Amite River At Bayou Manchac Point affecting East Baton Rouge Parish. For the Amite And Comite Rivers...including Bayou Manchac Point... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Amite River at Bayou Manchac Point. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, The river will begin to flood property along Bayou Manchac and the Amite River. Amite River Road and Horseshoe Drive will be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:10 AM CST Monday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 5.5 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 05/18/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM CST.
